# runtime.connect()

Make a connection between different contexts inside the extension.

You can call this:

- in an extension's content scripts, to establish a connection with the extension's background scripts (or similarly privileged scripts, like popup scripts or options page scripts).
- in an extension's background scripts (or similarly privileged scripts), to establish a connection with a different extension.

Note that you can't use this function to connect an extension to its content scripts. To do this, use [`tabs.connect()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/tabs/connect).

By default, this connection enables the extension to exchange messages with itself or any other extension (if `extensionId` is specified). However, the [`externally_connectable`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/manifest.json/externally_connectable) manifest key can be used to limit communication to specific extensions and enable communication with websites. Connections within the extension trigger the [`runtime.onConnect`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/onConnect) event, connections from other extensions or web pages trigger the [`runtime.onConnectExternal`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/onConnectExternal) event.

## In this article

- [Syntax](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#syntax)
- [Examples](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#examples)
- [Browser compatibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#browser_compatibility)

## [Syntax](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect\#syntax)

jsCopy

```
let port = browser.runtime.connect(
  extensionId, // optional string
  connectInfo  // optional object
)

```

### [Parameters](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect\#parameters)

[`extensionId` Optional](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#extensionid)

`string`. The ID of the extension to connect to. If the target has set an ID explicitly using the [browser\_specific\_settings](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/manifest.json/browser_specific_settings) key in manifest.json, then `extensionId` should have that value. Otherwise it should have the ID that was generated for the target.

[`connectInfo` Optional](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#connectinfo)

`object`. Details of the connection:

[`name` Optional](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#name)

`string`. Will be passed into [`runtime.onConnect`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/onConnect) for processes that are listening for the connection event.

[`includeTlsChannelId` Optional](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect#includetlschannelid)

`boolean`. Whether the TLS channel ID will be passed into [`runtime.onConnectExternal`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/onConnectExternal) for processes that are listening for the connection event.

### [Return value](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect\#return_value)

[`runtime.Port`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/Port). Port through which messages can be sent and received. The port's `onDisconnect` event is fired if the extension does not exist.

## [Examples](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect\#examples)

This content script:

- connects to the background script and stores the `Port` in a variable called `myPort`.
- listens for messages on `myPort` and logs them.
- sends messages to the background script, using `myPort`, when the user clicks the document.

jsCopy

```
// content-script.js

let myPort = browser.runtime.connect({ name: "port-from-cs" });
myPort.postMessage({ greeting: "hello from content script" });

myPort.onMessage.addListener((m) => {
  console.log("In content script, received message from background script: ");
  console.log(m.greeting);
});

document.body.addEventListener("click", () => {
  myPort.postMessage({ greeting: "they clicked the page!" });
});

```

The corresponding background script:

- listens for connection attempts from the content script.

- when it receives a connection attempt:
  - stores the port in a variable named `portFromCS`.
  - sends the content script a message using the port.
  - starts listening to messages received on the port, and logs them.
- sends messages to the content script, using `portFromCS`, when the user clicks the extension's browser action.


jsCopy

```
// background-script.js

let portFromCS;

function connected(p) {
  portFromCS = p;
  portFromCS.postMessage({ greeting: "hi there content script!" });
  portFromCS.onMessage.addListener((m) => {
    console.log("In background script, received message from content script");
    console.log(m.greeting);
  });
}

browser.runtime.onConnect.addListener(connected);

browser.browserAction.onClicked.addListener(() => {
  portFromCS.postMessage({ greeting: "they clicked the button!" });
});

```

## [Browser compatibility](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect\#browser_compatibility)

[Report problems with this compatibility data](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/API/runtime/connect# "Report an issue with this compatibility data") •

**Note:**
This API is based on Chromium's [`chrome.runtime`](https://developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/api/runtime#method-connect) API. This documentation is derived from [`runtime.json`](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/extensions/common/api/runtime.json) in the Chromium code.

11. [Interact with the clipboard](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Interact_with_the_clipboard)
12. [Extend the developer tools](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Extending_the_developer_tools)
13. [Build a cross-browser extension](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Build_a_cross_browser_extension)
